wikipedia_page.main: Richard Mallock (1843 – 28 June 1900) was a British Army officer and politician, born in Cockington Court, Torquay. He studied at Harrow School and the Royal Military Academy in Woolwich.  He then served as a lieutenant in the Royal Artillery from 1865 to 1876.  After leaving service, he was a justice of the peace.  At the 1885 UK general election, he stood unsuccessfully for the Conservative Party in Torquay, but he gained the seat in 1886, and held it until his retirement, in 1895.
